description:
Branch : Diablo stable

 try to create vm using curl command by setting the max count as grater than the quota limit and min count to 1 or less than the quota limit

Observation : it throws quota exceeded

Expected: it should create vms as much it can within the quota
for example if quota is 20 max count is 100 and min count is 1 and no vms are created previously then it should create 20 vms

<snip>
routray@ubuntu:~/novarc/st1$ nova list
+--------+------+--------+------------------------------------+
| ID | Name | Status | Networks |
+--------+------+--------+------------------------------------+
| 185742 | vm01 | ACTIVE | private=10.12.36.87, 15.184.125.26 |
+--------+------+--------+------------------------------------+
routray@ubuntu:~/novarc/st1$ curl -i https://<url>/v1.1/tenantid/servers -X POST -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: projectid" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <authtoken>" -d '{"server": {"name": "vm02", "imageRef": "161", "key_name": "satya", "flavorRef": "100", "max_count": 100, "min_count": 1}}'
HTTP/1.1 413 Request Entity Too Large
Cneonction: close
Content-Length: 117
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Date: Mon, 30 Apr 2012 06:19:29 GMT
Retry-After: 0

{"overLimit": {"message": "RAMLimitExceeded: You can only allocate 19456 RAM (in MB)", "code": 413, "retryAfter": 0}}
<snip>
title: nova api does not look into min count

comments.content:
This won't be fixed in diablo. Please confirm whether this is still an issue in folsom.

There is also an issue about whether or not this is unexpected behavior, as the client was returned a 413 correct, so it can renegotiate for a smaller max_count. The count quota wasn't actually what was hit, it was a memory quota. I'm not sure what the size limits on your flavorRef: 100 actually are, so it's hard to tell if it was 20 VMs at that flavor size that caused the problem. In which case I believe this is working as designed.

Please feel free to reopen with more info, though a recreate on folsom is important as well.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
